articleContent.title: Chord: Dominant 7th in C# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Dominant 7th in C# (Shape: A)

## Brief Presentation:
The Dominant 7th chord in the key of C# major, using the shape based on the A chord position, consists of the notes C# (the root), E#, G#, and B. This chord is commonly used in various musical genres to create tension and a sense of resolution within a chord progression.

## Notes and Intervals:
- C# (root)
- E# (major 3rd)
- G# (perfect 5th)
- B (minor 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
The Dominant 7th chord in C# (Shape: A) is frequently utilized in jazz, blues, funk, and rock music genres. It adds a bluesy and soulful flavor to the music, often creating a strong sense of movement towards the tonic chord.

## Songs:
1. "Sweet Home Chicago" by Robert Johnson
2. "Superstition" by Stevie Wonder
3. "All Along the Watchtower" by Jimi Hendrix
